DataElement.preferredName: Person Identifier Center for International Blood and Marrow Transplant Research Number Assignment Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An explanation that describes the indication for the Center for International Blood and Marrow Transplant Research identifier number assignment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: a means of uniquely identifying an individual.

Property.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 6/8/2010 released DECs as part of 1940 caLIMS2 CDEs.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Center for International Blood and Marrow Transplant Research Identifier Number Assignment Reason
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A combined research program of the National Marrow Donor Program and the Medical College of Wisconsin that collaborates with the global scientific community to advance hematopoietic cell transplantation and cellular therapy research worldwide._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification._An allotting or an appointment to a particular person or use, or for a particular time or object._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.): Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.

Concepts.definition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Utilization of specific cells, modified or not, for treatment of diseases. Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Utilization of specific cells, modified or not, for treatment of diseases. Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Utilization of specific cells, modified or not, for treatment of diseases. Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy.

Concepts.definition: Utilization of specific cells, modified or not, for treatment of diseases. Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An injury to the bone marrow resulting from exposure to high levels of ionizing radiation or exposure to other hazardous material.

Concepts.definition: An injury to the bone marrow resulting from exposure to high levels of ionizing radiation or exposure to other hazardous material.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the identification of patients' medical records and forms.

Concepts.longName: Center for International Blood and Marrow Transplant Research
Concepts.definition: A combined research program of the National Marrow Donor Program and the Medical College of Wisconsin that collaborates with the global scientific community to advance hematopoietic cell transplantation and cellular therapy research worldwide.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
An allotting or an appointment to a particular person or use, or for a particular time or object.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
